title: typo in tip's article on concurrency patterns
body:
Links to blog for article, article reads:

"This problem is a textbook of example of what is known as a race condition, but
the fix is trivial."

"textbook of example" => "textbook example"

Better yet is to make clear that the code does not have the problem but elegantly
sidestepped it.

"This could have been a textbook example of what is known as a race condition, but
that was avoided by buffering the channel ch (by specifying the buffer length as the
second argument to make), guaranteeing that the first send has a place to put the value.
"
